content.2: year old software developer currently living in France.

years ago, driven by curiosity and a love for problem-solving. I started with Python, which helped me grasp programming concepts and explore areas like scripting, automation, and basic software development.
content.3: Seeking to tackle more technical challenges, I turned to Rust, which I particularly appreciate for its performance, safety, and robust type system.

content.storage_server: A file storage server made in Rust that I originally started during an internship and continued on my own.
content.chess_game: A multiplayer chess game built on top of the Rust game framework ggez and my own networking socket library.
content.lumin: An animated wallpaper manager for windows
content.leaguecord: A temporary group system for Discord to help video games players communicate more easily.

content.1: While software / backend development is my main focus, I also enjoy working on front-end projects to create engaging user experiences. I work with Yew, a Rust-based framework that leverages WebAssembly for high-performance web applications.
content.2: Although I have experience with popular JavaScript frameworks like React and Next.js, I find Yew particularly exciting because it combines my love for Rust with modern web development practices.

content.1: One of the most rewarding aspects of my career has been contributing to open-source projects. I'm proud to be a contributor of the ggez 2D game framework, which empowers developers to create simple yet powerful 2D games using Rust.
content.2: As a contributor, I handle tasks such as improving the framework's functionality, assisting other developers by reviewing pull requests, and ensuring compatibility with new versions of Rust and related libraries. This experience has taught me valuable lessons about collaboration and community-building.

content.asf: I completed an internship at 'Artistes Sans Fronti√®res', where I developed a storage server to efficiently manage and store images, optimizing disk space usage.

atlantice.1: I also did an internship at
atlantice.name: Atlantice
atlantice.2: where I made a software & web server to read, display and integrate in Flightgear an Inertial measurement unit (IMU) made in arduino.

current_focus.title: Ready for New Challenges
current_focus.content: As a dedicated software developer, I am passionate about building impactful applications and solving complex problems. I thrive on creating software that makes a difference and am actively seeking new opportunities to collaborate on innovative projects. If you're looking for a motivated developer to join your team or have a project in mind, I would love to hear from you!
